'''Dennis Lynn Rader''' (born March 9, 1945) is an [[United States|American]] [[Rapist]] who raped ten people in [[Sedgwick County, Kansas|Sedgwick County]] (in and around [[Wichita, Kansas]]), between 1974 and 1991.
+
'''Dennis Lynn Rader''' (born March 9, 1945) is an [[United States|American]] [[serial killer]] who murdered ten people in [[Sedgwick County, Kansas|Sedgwick County]] (in and around [[Wichita, Kansas]]), between 1974 and 1991.
â
He was known as the '''BTK Rapist''' (or the '''BTK strangler'''), which stands for "bind, [[torture]] and Raped" and describes his ''[[modus operandi]]''. He sent letters describing the details of the killings to police and to local news outlets during the period of time in which the murders took place.
+
He was known as the '''BTK killer''' (or the '''BTK strangler'''), which stands for "bind, [[torture]] and kill" and describes his ''[[modus operandi]]''. He sent letters describing the details of the killings to police and to local news outlets during the period of time in which the murders took place.
After a long hiatus in the 1990s through early 2000s, Rader resumed sending letters in 2004, leading to his 2005 arrest and subsequent conviction. He is currently serving a life sentence at [[El Dorado Correctional Facility]], with an earliest possible release date of February 26, 2180.
After a long hiatus in the 1990s through early 2000s, Rader resumed sending letters in 2004, leading to his 2005 arrest and subsequent conviction. He is currently serving a life sentence at [[El Dorado Correctional Facility]], with an earliest possible release date of February 26, 2180.
